title: Introduction

content:
Welcome to my blog! I’m a software engineer with a keen interest in finance, trading, and personal development. I approach both my work and my growth with a mindset of continual learning, always refining and improving my skills.
One idea that really resonates with me is hedgemanship—a term I’ve shamelessly borrowed from Conrad Thomas’ lesser-known 1970s book with the iconic title, Hedgemanship: How to make money in bull markets, bear markets and chicken markets while confounding professional money managers and attracting a better class of women. For me, it’s not just about managing risk—it’s about taking a craftsman’s approach to trading, striving for precision, and continuous improvement of strategies and processes over time.
“How to make money in bull markets, bear markets and chicken markets while confounding professional money managers and attracting a better class of women.”
— Conrad Thomas, Hedgemanship
This blog is a place to share my thoughts on trading, personal growth, and the ongoing process of improvement. I hope you find something here that sparks your curiosity. Thanks for stopping by!
